item.title: Citation in Markdown syntax for Hugo, Jekyll, and Github Readme files
item.description: Inline citations are references to external sources directly embedded within the text itself. They serve multiple purposes, including providing evidence for claims, giving credit to original authors, and guiding readers to additional resources for further exploration. We can use Markdown’s footnotes1 syntax to use inline citation in Markdown (.md) files. Similar to how citations are used in academic writing, footnotes are a suitable method for referring to links, books, papers, and other sources without disrupting the flow of the text.
